title: Who will start at quarterback for the Vikings, Browns and Jets? We made QB1 predictions for all 32 teams
content: Will Kirk Cousins go back to Minnesota? Could Kyler Murray join the AFC? Let's predict who will start for every team in the 2026 season.

title: Ranking the top offseason trade candidates: Who are the best players potentially available?
content: How do Brian Thomas Jr. and Maxx Crosby stack up on the trade market? We break down the latest intel.

title: Top NFL prospect Reese says he's an OLB/edge
content: Ohio State star Arvell Reese, one of the top prospects in April's NFL draft, declared himself an "outside linebacker/edge" rusher during media interviews at the combine Wednesday.

title: Pens' Crosby put on IR, to miss at least 4 weeks
content: Pittsburgh Penguins captain Sidney Crosby will miss at least four weeks after he was moved to injured reserve, the team announced Wednesday.

title: Bain: NFL teams focused on play, not arm length
content: Defensive end Rueben Bain Jr. said no team has mentioned arm length to him during his interviews, focusing on his play instead.

title: Sources: Aubrey pushes for bigger Cowboys offer
content: The Cowboys have extended an offer to Brandon Aubrey that would make him the highest-paid kicker in the NFL, sources told ESPN, but Aubrey's agent has asked for a deal closer to $10 million per season.

title: Hellebuyck set for Medal of Freedom, Trump says
content: Connor Hellebuyck, the goaltender for the gold-medal-winning U.S. men's Olympic hockey team, will be awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom, President Donald Trump announced during Tuesday night's State of the Union.

title: Botched final play sees Luka hesitate, LeBron miss
content: The Lakers lost to the Magic 110-109 on Tuesday after a botched sidelines out-of-bounds play between LeBron James and Luka Doncic in the final seconds failed to produce a quality shot.

title: Boozer goes off as Duke beats Notre Dame by 44
content: Cameron Boozer had 24 points and 13 rebounds as No. 1 Duke beat Notre Dame 100-56 on Tuesday night, handing the Irish their worst home loss since 1898.

title: Lynch believes 49ers, Williams 'on the same page'
content: Shortly after ESPN's Adam Schefter reported Tuesday that left tackle Trent Williams and the 49ers are "struggling to find a contractual solution," general manager John Lynch offered a more optimistic perspective.

title: üèà Kiper's NFL mock draft: Projecting Round 1
content: As the NFL gets ready for this week's combine workouts, let's project where the best players in the 2026 NFL draft class will get picked in April.

content: In late 2002, Nike began creating a global campaign featuring the black mamba -- and presented it to an NBA superstar. That star was not Kobe Bryant.

content: The schools (Oklahoma? Syracuse?), names (Will Wade? Porter Moser? Josh Schertz?) and buzz we're tracking.

content: Sometimes one big win can elevate a team off the bubble. Clemson and Virginia got those victories Sunday.

title: Champions League's biggest upsets: Bodo/Glimt join list of giant killers
content: Norwegian minnows Bodo/Glimt pulled off one of the biggest Champions League upsets ever by eliminating Inter. Here are 10 more major shocks.

title: Freshmen facing pressure in 2026
content: With big money and big expectations, first-year players such as five-stars Jared Curtis and Jackson Cantwell have work ahead.

title: They're back! Key returning players for every top 25 team
content: With all the focus on the portal, we look at the most important players retained across college football.

content: Let's overreact to the latest fixtures of a potentially epic Premier League season, from Spurs' dire straits to Chelsea's shot at unwanted history.

title: How do Shakhtar keep signing so many Brazilians amid Russia-Ukraine war?
content: The flow of Brazilian players to Shakhtar Donetsk hasn't stopped since Russia's invasion of Ukraine began.

content: In a time of transition for USA basketball, here's what the 12-man squad that will go up against a competitive international slate could look like.

title: Boxing pound-for-pound rankings: Bivol, Beterbiev out; who replaces them?
content: Dmitry Bivol and Artur Beterbiev are out of the top 10 for inactivity. Here are the latest ESPN pound-for-pound rankings.

title: Divisional rankings: Ryan Garcia enters welterweight top five
content: A masterful title fight performance from Garcia earns him a WBC belt and a spot among the welterweight elite.

content: Nine tips to use during the fantasy baseball season, from trade strategies to how to value rookies and closers

title: Fantasy fast break: Has Zion put durability questions behind him?
content: A look around the league reveals Zion Williamson finding the ability to stay on the court, plus emerging options on the Clippers, Kings and Jazz.

content: The essential Monday guide to fantasy hockey pickups, with who to add and how to get set for the week ahead.

content: In its response, the Rural Development Ministry said the information could not be shared because the scheme ‚Äòhas not yet been formally notified by the States/UTs and has not become operational in any State/U.T.‚Äô

title: ‚ÄòLoose connection‚Äô prevented NVS-02 satellite from landing in intended orbit, says panel
content: The committee, which probed the failure, says the signal meant to activate a key valve in the engine‚Äôs oxidiser line never reached it; this valve is crucial for firing the engine to raise the spacecraft‚Äôs orbit

title: PM Modi conferred with Israel‚Äôs ‚ÄòSpeaker of the Knesset Medal‚Äô
content: The medal was conferred in recognition of the Prime Minister‚Äôs exceptional contribution ‚Äî through his personal leadership ‚Äî to strengthen strategic relations between India and Israel

title: Palaniswami hits back at Stalin, calls the DMK a ‚Äòslave‚Äô of the Congress
content: ‚ÄòWe have never been slaves of anyone. We believe in our constructive work. By implementing [welfare] projects, we had secured the support [of the Centre]. But your party is not like us. The Congress had secured seats by intimidating the¬†DMK,‚Äô the AIADMK leader says at a meeting at Vanagaram near Chennai

title: Ahead of Assembly election, DMK women‚Äôs  grassroots push blends politics with AR outreach
content: ‚ÄòVellum Tamil Pengal‚Äô campaign deploys booth-level women cadres armed with booklets, QR codes and augmented reality to deepen voter connect ‚Äî while opening new space for women in party politics.

title: ECI proposes synergy with SECs to align electoral processes nationwide
content: Commission moots sharing of Electronic Voting Machines (EVM), electoral rolls and the ECINET digital platform.

title: Kochi City police screen footage of accidents to sensitise bus drivers
content: Videos of around 25 recent accidents, captured by CCTVs on the accident spots and those installed inside buses, from different parts of the State were screened

title: Gaza peace initiative holds promise of ‚Äòjust and durable peace‚Äô in region: PM Modi in Israel
content: In the Knesset, PM Modi condemned the ‚Äúbarbaric terrorist attack‚Äù by Hamas and said, ‚ÄúWe feel your pain; we share your grief. India stands with Israel firmly and with full conviction‚Äù

title: 1.2 crore names may be deleted after SIR in Bengal, says Mamata
content: Will pray for the people who will find their names deleted from the final electoral rolls on February 28, says Trinamool Congress chairperson ¬†

title: Government to procure new business jets for defence leadership
content: The decision to get a new fleet comes in the backdrop of the crash of a VSR Ventures-owned aircraft on January 28 that claimed the lives of Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra‚Äôs Deputy Chief Minister, and four others

title: PM Modi, Netanyahu discuss wide range of issues aimed at boosting bilateral ties
content: Narendra Modi, who is visiting Israel for the second time in nine years, was received by Benjamin Netanyahu and his wife, Sara, at the airport.

title: Police intensify probe into IIT Palakkad attack
content: Police suspect the assault was premeditated, noting that it took place in a poorly lit area of the campus that lacked surveillance camera coverage

title: ‚ÄòKaraparamba fish market, Puthiyangadi market buildings in need of urgent action‚Äô
content: An inspection by a team of engineers under the Kozhikode Corporation have so far completed the inspection of 12 age-old buildings within the city to check their fitness

title: U.S. slaps 126% duty on Indian solar imports
content: Tariffs were collectively imposed on India, Indonesia and Laos following  investigation that is ongoing

title: BJP warns of protest if recruitment process is not initiated in Karnataka
content: Taking exception to the State government not going ahead with recruitments to government posts as promised by the Congress before the Assembly elections, BJP State president B.Y. Vijayendra warned of a protest if the recruitment process was not initiated

title: PM Modi condoles death of veteran CPI leader Nallakannu
content: R. Nallakannu died at a government hospital in Chennai due to age-related ailments; he was about 101 years old.

title: Kerala‚Äôs Puthur Zoological Park to open for public on February 28
content: To help visitors explore the park, two non-AC electric buses of the Kerala State Road Transport Corporation have been readied. 330 animals have been shifted to 14 habitats

title: YSRCP regime destroyed State, says Naidu
content: Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy played a false drama that Veligonda works were finished and dedicated the project to the nation without completing them, claims Chief Minister

title: YC urges Kerala Governor not to approve State govt. nominee as PSC member
content: Youth Congress State president criticises government‚Äôs decision to raise upper age limit for PSC examinations to 40, calling it misleading and unfair to existing job aspirants

title: Greens slams forest dept. for rejecting human-wildlife mitigation grant
content: The department has succumbed to threats from certain organisations acting under the guise of farmer interests to reject the project, which was initiated by the MoEFCC to alleviate tensions in areas outside tiger reserves, say Wayanad Prakrithi Samrakshana Samithi

title: AKSSA demands immediate recruitment to vacant posts
content: Karnataka State Students Association president Kanthakumar urges State govt. to immediately announce a clear recruitment schedule

title: Kerala‚Äôs fisherfolk 'army' gets valuable rescue lessons from NIWS Goa
content: Kerala Fisheries department has been funding the training of selected fishermen from the State in sea rescue at the National Institute of Water Sports. Presently the 24th batch is undergoing training

title: CM is giving misleading information on employment, says Arvind Bellad
content: The Deputy Leader of Opposition has accused Siddaramaiah of making claims about providing jobs even before completing the process

title: CM inaugurates KTDC‚Äôs five-star resort at Muzhappilangad
content: The ‚Çπ238-crore integrated project aims to strengthen tourism infrastructure at Muzhappilangad beach, Dharmadam beach, and Dharmadam Island to attract more domestic and international visitors: CM

title: A.P. Assembly approves ‚Çπ41,590 crore grants for key departments
content: ‚Çπ863 crore given away for Governor, Council of Ministers, general administration and elections;  liabilities of ‚Çπ24,811 crore cleared in recent months

title: Be architects of India‚Äôs growth story, Adarsh Group CMD tells graduates
content: Adarsh Group CMD urges students to shape India‚Äôs fast-growing future during the 8th convocation of JSS Science and Technology University

title: Name change may come at a high cost for Kerala
content: The name Kerala will have to be replaced with Keralam in all the official entries. The humongous process of changing the name boards of government institutions, departments and vehicles, letterheads, official seals and stamp papers awaits the State

title: CM unveils IRIA, says Kerala leads India in holistic Ayurveda research
content: The Chief Minister underscores the need to recognise and collaborate with skilled traditional healers, whose experiential knowledge can strengthen young researchers

title: Ahead of Kerala Assembly polls, Congress leader Ramesh Chennithala steps up community connect, party sees strategic role
content: Chennithala visits  headquarters of Malankara Orthodox Syrian Church and Nair Service Society in Kottayam

title: Milk adulteration in A.P.: 15 persons still critical, toxicology reports awaited
content: The milk and ghee samples are being tested in VIMTA laboratory, Hyderabad and Food Testing Laboratory in JNTU-Kakinada

title: 'We feel your pain': PM Modi condemns 'barbaric' Hamas attack in historic Knesset speech
content: ‚ÄãPrime Minister Narendra Modi arrived at the Knesset, where Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his wife Sara Netanyahu attended an official reception ceremony on Wednesday. With 'Modi, Modi' chants, PM Narendra Modi receives a standing ovation at the Knesset, Israeli parliament, upon his arrival. PM Modi extended condolences over the "barbaric terrorist attack Hamas carried out on October 7, 2023.

title: 'Speaker of the Knesset Medal': PM Modi conferred with Israel's highest parliamentary honour
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received the prestigious "Speaker of the Knesset Medal," Israel's highest parliamentary honour, for bolstering strategic ties. He is the first Indian PM to be so recognized. This visit also saw him address the Israeli parliament for the first time, emphasizing friendship and partnership with the nation.

title: 'Pressure does funny things': Giant-killer Zimbabwe warn wounded India
content: Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl believes the pressure of a must-win T20 World Cup match against India could affect the hosts. He highlighted Zimbabwe's diverse bowling attack as a potential advantage against India's strong batting lineup. Burl also confirmed captain Sikandar Raza is fit to play.

title: Microsoft partners with SpaceX in its second tie up with an Elon Musk company
content: Microsoft is teaming up with Elon Musk's SpaceX to bring Starlink internet to rural Kenya, aiming to connect 450 community hubs. This follows Microsoft's earlier collaboration with Musk's xAI for AI services.  Meanwhile, a consortium including Microsoft, Nvidia, and BlackRock is investing $40 billion in data centers to fuel AI growth.

title: India & Israel will build iron alliance against threat of extremist Islam: Netanyahu
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced an "iron alliance" with India against extremist Islam, emphasizing shared values of moderation and human dignity. He lauded the "miraculous" bilateral relationship, highlighting doubled trade and tripled cooperation. Netanyahu expressed deep gratitude for India's support following the October 7th attack, calling Israel's campaign a "defensive war for the truth."

title: Sam Altman at IIT-Delhi: 'Traditional career advice won‚Äôt work in the AI era'
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman advised young Indians against solely relying on traditional career advice, emphasizing the need to develop and trust their own intuition in the rapidly changing AI era. He acknowledged that while some jobs will disappear, new ones will emerge, urging a balanced perspective on AI's impact and encouraging calculated risk-taking for future success.

title: Trumponomics: Over a year into 2nd term, Donald‚Äôs economic policy shows mixed results
content: US President Donald Trump's second term sees a mixed economic picture: strong growth and tech investment clash with stalled job gains and inflation worries.  Supreme Court's tariff ruling adds uncertainty. While manufacturing output rises, factory jobs decline.  Affordability remains a concern for households despite overall economic momentum.

title: Delhi quadruple murder: Pregnant woman, three daughters found with throats slit; husband missing
content: A pregnant woman and her three young daughters were found murdered with their throats slit in their Delhi home. Police are searching for the woman's husband, a vegetable seller, who is the prime suspect and has been missing since the morning. The motive is under investigation, with potential angles including preference for a male child.

title: Nasa's ambitious Moon mission delayed: Artemis II rocket rolled back for repairs
content: NASA has rolled back its Artemis II moon rocket and Orion spacecraft from the launch pad to the Vehicle Assembly Building due to a new technical issue with the helium pressurisation system. This setback, following earlier hydrogen leaks, means the planned March launch window is now unattainable.

title: Beyond coding: Why Anthropic‚Äôs CEO says human skills matter more in the AI era
content: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei advises students and young professionals to pivot towards human-centered skills, steering clear of rapidly AI-dominated fields like software engineering and math. He emphasizes tasks involving relating to people and suggests focusing on areas like the semiconductor space, which blends physical and traditional engineering.

title: Indian man deported from Singapore in alleged job visa scam
content: A Bhayandar man was deported from Singapore after his work visa and job offer were found to be fake, costing him INR 3.6 lakh. Immigration authorities discovered the company didn't exist and the visa was forged. Police are investigating the suspected job scam. Experts urge job seekers to verify employers and visa procedures independently to avoid such fraudulent schemes.

title: Red Fort blast case: NIA arrests two more terror suspects, 11 apprehended in total
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested two more individuals, Zameer Ahmad Ahangar and Tufail Ahmad Bhat, in connection with last year's Red Fort area blast. These arrests bring the total to 11, with the duo allegedly supplying weapons to the prime accused. Investigations reveal they were active overground workers for the Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind terror outfit.

title: Candace Owens sparks backlash with ‚ÄúBride of Charlie‚Äù series on Erika Kirk
content: Candace Owens has stirred major controversy after releasing the trailer for her YouTube investigative series The Bride of Charlie, centered on Erika Kirk. The preview quickly went viral, prompting backlash, intense online debate, and questions directed at Charlie Kirk‚Äôs allies. While supporters call it accountability journalism, critics warn it risks harassment and speculation, as silence from prominent conservative voices fuels growing tension.

title: NFL mock draft 2026: Vikings, Rams, Cardinals & Jets first-round picks
content: NFL Mock Draft 2026 sees struggling teams like the New York Jets and Arizona Cardinals securing top picks, while playoff teams fill in for later slots. ESPN‚Äôs analyst predicts key prospects like Dillon Thieneman for the Minnesota Vikings and Blake Miller for the Los Angeles Rams, pairing franchise needs with promising young talent.

title: Flames trade talks stall over Nazem Kadri salary dispute
content: The Calgary Flames are considering a trade with Nazem Kadri; however, an issue involving the salary and a contract is holding back the process. The veteran center has been attracting the attention of several NHL clubs. Calgary has, however, not been keen on salary retention, hence making negotiations difficult. The trade deadline is fast approaching, and there is increasing pressure to either keep Kadri in Calgary or sell him to a contender.

title: 'It's saffron!' PM Modi reacts to colour of Sara Netanyahu's outfit - watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a warm welcome in Tel Aviv, with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu noting the matching saffron colors of Modi's pocket square and his wife's outfit. Modi's visit, the first by an Indian PM to the Knesset, aims to strengthen the "robust and multifaceted Strategic Partnership" between India and Israel.

title: AI disruption: At $380bn, Anthropic valuation more than combined market cap of top Indian IT stocks
content: The swift advancement of artificial intelligence - particularly Anthropic‚Äôs recent innovations - has unsettled Indian technology stocks. The impact has been sharp, with the Nifty IT index dropping about 21% in February.

title: Cigarettes after tax: Smokers left fuming, tobacco black market lights up
content: India's recent steep cigarette tax hike has triggered immediate chaos, with prices soaring and supplies dwindling. Retailers are struggling, and consumers face inflated costs. This mirrors global trends where high taxes, without robust enforcement, fuel illicit trade and organized crime, potentially undermining public health goals and government revenue.

title: 'It was just too much': Manjrekar tears into Gautam Gambhir's tactics
content: Sanjay Manjrekar criticized Gautam Gambhir's tactics after India's heavy T20 World Cup loss to South Africa. He questioned promoting Washington Sundar to number five, calling him an 'all-in-one' solution for batting and bowling issues. Manjrekar also highlighted the team's struggle with slower balls, urging focus on this area before their crucial match against Zimbabwe.

title: 'Galti se ho gaya': Son's flippant reply on why he shot father, chopped up body ‚Äî watch
content: A chilling video has surfaced showing a 21-year-old Lucknow man calmly claiming ‚ÄúGalti se ho gaya‚Äù (‚ÄúIt happened by mistake‚Äù) after allegedly shooting and dismembering his father following a heated argument over exam pressure. The accused from the chilling Lucknow murder case, Akshat, is seen offering the brief remark when questioned about the gruesome crime.

title: The Ayyappa awaits: Sabarimala supreme's sanctum nears Supreme Court's final verdict
content: ‚ÄãIn 2006, the Indian Young Lawyers Association approached the Supreme Court of India, arguing that barring women violated constitutional guarantees of equality and freedom of religion. By 2016, the Court began openly questioning whether such a ban could withstand constitutional scrutiny. In September 2018, a five-judge Constitution Bench delivered a 4 to 1 verdict that shook Kerala.

title: Can Pakistan still qualify for T20 World Cup semifinal after loss to England?
content: England secured a T20 World Cup 2026 semi-final spot after a thrilling victory over Pakistan. Captain Harry Brook's maiden T20I century was the highlight, guiding England home in a tense chase. Pakistan's qualification now hinges on other results, facing a challenging path to the last four.

title: CBSE withdraws Noida school affiliation after HC probe ‚Äî what it means for students
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education has withdrawn the affiliation of a Noida-based school after an inquiry confirmed complaints of mental harassment, forced salary deductions and administrative irregularities. Acting on directions from the Allahabad High Court, CBSE found serious violations of its Affiliation Bye-Laws and workplace safety norms. While Class X and XII students can complete the current session, those in Classes IX and XI will be shifted to nearby schools for the next academic year.

title: 'Attack will bring strong response': Iran pushes back against Trump a day before Geneva talks
content: Iran has strongly refuted US President Trump's accusations of rebuilding nuclear and missile capabilities, calling them "big lies." Ahead of crucial talks in Geneva, Iranian officials stated that "honourable diplomacy" could lead to success, but warned against confrontation. Tehran insists its dignity and mutual interests must be respected during negotiations.

title: This engineer from Bihar chose to become a househusband, and why every man should read his story
content: Amit Kumar Dubey, a proud house husband from Bihar, has redefined traditional gender roles by dedicating himself to full-time household management. He gave up his job to support his wife, handling cooking, cleaning, and childcare. Despite occasional worries about his responsibilities as the eldest son, Amit finds fulfillment in his role, supported by his wife and family.

title: 'Huge mistake': Bill Gates admits affairs with Russian women; apologises for Epstein link
content: Bill Gates has apologised to Gates Foundation staff for his association with Jeffrey Epstein, admitting it was a "huge mistake" that harmed the organisation's reputation. While asserting he "did nothing illicit," Gates acknowledged meetings continued after Epstein's conviction and that his ties helped Epstein "burnish his reputation." He also admitted to two affairs during his marriage.

title: Home, smart home: How AI is rewiring India's housing sector
content: Artificial intelligence is revolutionizing India's real estate, from smart apartment features like biometric access and predictive maintenance to enhanced commercial design and lease analysis. Wealthy, tech-savvy homebuyers are driving demand for intelligent homes, while AI tools are also aiding architects and developers in planning and cost-saving.

title: 'The Kerala Story 2': Kerala HC orders makers to not release film's rights
content: The Kerala High Court has ordered the makers of 'The Kerala Story 2' to halt the release of its rights pending a ruling on petitions challenging its certification. The court questioned the U/A certification, deeming petitioners' concerns "probably genuine" and urging producers to wait for the verdict.

title: Told to pay, BJP MLA Chaudhary Babulal‚Äôs son slaps Agra toll plaza employee
content: Son of Fatehpur Sikri MLA Chaudhary Babulal allegedly slapped a toll employee at Raybha toll plaza after being asked to pay the toll fee due to a missing FASTag. The incident, captured on CCTV, was reportedly resolved amicably with the toll worker declining to file a complaint. The MLA, however, alleged abusive behavior from the toll staff.

title: 'I would never want to coach in Pakistan': Former England captain's blunt take
content: Babar Azam's struggles at the T20 World Cup are under intense scrutiny, with his batting role and form drawing criticism. Former England captain Michael Vaughan, however, believes coach Mike Hesson has navigated Pakistan's complex cricket politics well, suggesting Babar's anchoring style suits Sri Lankan conditions if others play aggressively around him.

title: NCERT row: Textbook with chapter on 'corruption in judiciary' pulled off shelves
content: NCERT has withdrawn its new Class 8 Social Science textbook. This action follows the inclusion of a section on corruption in the judiciary. The Supreme Court intervened after the matter was raised. Chief Justice of India Surya Kant stated the institution would not allow defamation. Senior lawyers highlighted the selective focus on the judiciary.

title: Cardi B‚Äôs tour clapback sparks buzz as fans think she‚Äôs sending a clear message to Stefon Diggs
content: Cardi B shut down critics who doubted her commitment to the Little Miss Drama Tour after becoming a new mom. She highlighted sold-out shows and said she takes performing seriously, treating concerts like celebrations with fans. Sharing four children, including one with NFL star Stefon Diggs, the rapper continues to balance motherhood and music while proving her professionalism on stage.

title: Where to invest Rs 1 lakh - gold, silver, stocks, mutual funds? Experts decode right mix
content: While experts believe that one investment strategy doesn‚Äôt work for everyone, and risk profile and time horizon play a crucial role, they are broadly in consensus on what a large part of your portfolio should look like.

title: IndiGo chaos: Over 200 flyers stuck for 5 hours in plane at Chennai airport
content: Over 200 IndiGo passengers faced a grueling 5-hour delay for their Singapore-bound flight from Chennai due to a cabin temperature issue and crew duty hour limitations. Passengers reported suffocation and lack of clear communication, with a viral video capturing their distress. An alternate crew was arranged, leading to the significant delay.

title: 'Puppet of foreign powers': BJP labels Rahul, Gandhi clan & Congress 'compromised'
content: Putting all the members of the Gandhi family, who have ruled the nation, in the dock, the Union minister said the clan never "shied away from compromising the country". He went further back to attack the Nehru-Gandhi family as he highlighted the infamous Bofors scandal that was widely reported during Rajiv Gandhi's tenure and had been the reason behind the fall of his government.

title: Nallakannu - a guiding light of simplicity, commitment and principled politics
content: R Nallakannu, who died in Chennai on Wednesday at the age of 101, represented a generation of leaders shaped by the freedom struggle and guided by ideological discipline rather than personal ambition

title: How Modi‚Äôs Israel trip could impact India‚Äôs West Asia relations
content: The Prime Minister‚Äôs visit will help deepen engagement with Tel Aviv, going far beyond routine diplomacy

title: Stalin to lay foundation for Mini TIDEL Parks in Erode, Tirunelveli, Virudhunagar districts on February 26
content: These parks offer space of about 60,000 sq.ft. and are designed to foster growth, support startups, and create jobs for around 600 IT professionals in each location

title: Delhi High Court dismisses PIL over information on Ahmedabad plane crash
content: The court terms it ‚Äòhighly misconceived‚Äô; the petitioner urged the court that the preliminary probe report of Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau (AAIB) should include details on the ‚Äòcomplete sequence of events‚Äô that led to the Air India plane crash in Ahmedabad last June

title: CMO rebuffs Chennithala‚Äôs accusation on data leak
content: CMO says  data collection spearheaded by the State‚Äôs IT Mission is a precursor to the creation of a centralised notification hub for government services

title: Call to check safety rule violations in granite quarries
content: The immediate trigger for the renewed protests was an incident at Thottumukkam on February 22 in which two residents sustained injuries after broken pieces of granite stones fell on them following a blast at a nearby quarry

title: Watch: Renaming West Bengal: Mamata alleges bias after Centre clears ‚ÄòKeralam‚Äô
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has accused the Union Government of ignoring repeated proposals to rename West Bengal as ‚ÄòBangla‚Äô, hours after the Union Cabinet approved Kerala‚Äôs renaming as ‚ÄòKeralam‚Äô.

title: Building collapse: stern action against those responsible for lapses
content: The structural stability of buildings in Kozhikode city should be examined seriously by the Corporation, he says

title: Demand for Dalit CM natural, says Satish Jarkiholi
content: Stating that it does not mean Siddaramaiah should be unseated, he says that there is nothing wrong in fresh MLAs seeking Cabinet berths

title: A.P. Cabinet clears projects worth ‚Çπ980 crore in Amaravati
content: Administrative sanctions given for critical mechanical, electrical and plumbing works in the Assembly and High Court buildings in Amaravati

title: Courts now justify environment degradation: former Supreme Court judge
content: Referring to decisions such as clean chit to Vantara and allowing the great Nicobar project, Justice Deepak Gupta says the role of courts does not end in just seeing if the procedure has been followed

title: Transfer rumors, news: Alisson to leave Liverpool for Juve?
content: Juventus could make a move for goalkeeper Alisson when he enters the final year of his contract at anfield in the summer . the 33-year-old has remained the starter for the reds this season despite their acquisition of substitute goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardas .

title: Top 25 rankings, play of the week and what to watch
content: the Razorbacks beat the Musketeers 7-6 in a road series against Tennessee . the Vols dropped seven spots to no. 20 in this week's rankings . they're facing the top team in the country in UCLA on Friday .

title: Kerala couple adopts 15-month-old girl through CARA
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Power Rankings: Stakes are high for UCLA, two teams rejoin the list
content: the Bruins will be just the fourth program to finish with a perfect regular season in the Big Ten women's college basketball . the last to do it was Maryland in 2015, the season the Terps joined the big Ten and advanced to the final Four for the second year in a row .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Will the Wolves rise? Where all 30 teams land after All-Star break

title: Week 3 Top 25 and how to watch
content: Sophia Knight was named SEC Player of the Week after going 11-for-13 last week . she has recorded eight multi-hit games and is hitting .543 through the first 14 games of the season . here is the complete scoreboard here to stay up to date this spring .

title: Hooked on hockey after the Olympics? An updated look at the NHL's playoff picture

title: Does Sam Altman think humans are batteries?
content: Nirmalya Dutta is an editorial consultant with The Times of India. He covers world news, pop culture, and philosophical memes. He writes the column Random Musings and The Weekly Vine, a newsletter that blends news, culture, and humour with a touch of chaos. He is also the co-creator of Meow Times, a satirical cartoon strip about the absurdities of corporate life. His political, moral, and economic views drift somewhere between woke-Leninist, Rand-Marxist, and Keynesian-Friedmanite, though he isn‚Äôt entirely sure what any of those terms mean. Read More

title: "Modi Hug Is Special": Netanyahu's High Praise For "Brother" PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's trademark "hugplomacy", where he embraces world leaders in his trademark hug, has once again drawn international attention after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu praised what he called the famous "Modi hug".

title: "We Remember Israeli Lives Lost In 26/11": PM Modi's Top Quotes In Knesset
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday addressed the Knesset, Israel's parliament-- a rare honour that underscores the political warmth between the two democracies.

title: On Camera, Vendors Apply Rat Poison To Fruits In Mumbai
content: Two fruit sellers in Mumbai's Malad West area have been arrested after a video appeared to show them applying rat poison to fruits offered for sale.

title: PM Modi Israel visit LIVE: "I Was Born On Day India Recognised Israel": PM Modi To Knesset
content: Narendra Modi Israel Visit LIVE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is travelling to Israel on a two-day high-profile visit on Wednesday, marking his second trip to Tel Aviv after the historic 2017 visit.

title: "That's Saffron": PM Modi As Netanyahu Notes Sartorial Match With Wife
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Israel on Wednesday to a warm welcome from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his wife, Sara Netanyahu, who were on the tarmac to receive him at the airport.

title: Delhi Couple Sent To 14-Day Custody For Racist Attack On Arunachal Women
content: A Delhi court on Wednesday sent a couple accused of hurling racial slurs at their neighbours from Arunachal Pradesh to 14 days of judicial custody.

title: Kerala Health Minister Injured During Opposition Protest, Hospitalised
content: Kerala Health Minister Veena George was injured as opposition student activists, protesting against her, clashed with police at the Kannur railway station, forcing her to cancel her onward journey and seek medical treatment.

title: Himachal Vigilance Chief Absent For Days, State Puts Second Officer In Charge
content: Frequent leaves taken by IPS officer Aditi Singh over the past three months has led the Himachal Pradesh government to hand over the additional charge of SP Vigilance to ASP V

title: "Hunt Continues": IEDs, Grenades, Pistol Recovered From J&K's Poonch
content: The joint security forces on Wednesday recovered Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs), arms and ammunition in the forests of Jammu and Kashmir's Pooch district.

title: On Camera, Bride Shot In Stomach On Wedding Stage In Bihar
content: A wedding ceremony in Bihar's Buxar turned into mourning on Tuesday night after the bride was shot allegedly by her lover. The man has been identified as Deenbandhu, a neighbour.

title: Army Pilot Wounded In Maduro Raid Receives Medal Of Honour From Trump
content: US President Donald Trump awarded the Congressional Medal of Honor to Army Chief Warrant Officer5 Eric Slover during his State of the Union address on Tuesday.

title: After El Mencho's Death, Name Of Rumoured New Jalisco Cartel Boss Emerges
content: Days after the death of Nemesio Oseguera Cervantes, known as "El Mencho," attention has turned to his potential successor and new leader of the Jalisco Cartel. A California-born stepson of the drug lord is reportedly in line to succeed him.

title: British Borrowed Rs 35,000 Over 100 Years Ago. Indian Family Demands It Back
content: The British Empire once prided itself on being the realm where the sun never set. But in the quiet town of Sehore in Madhya Pradesh, a forgotten piece of paper suggests that even the mighty Empire once needed a sunrise loan from a wealthy local.

title: 'Like Mujibur Rahman': Congress After Nehru Statue Pulled Down In Assam
content: A 10-foot statue of India's first Prime Minister, Jawaharlal Nehru, was pulled down by unidentified vandals at Pailapool in Assam's Cachar district.

title: 6,800 km From Epstein Island, His Paris Lair Surfaces With Disturbing Details
content: The photographs show an 18-room residence saturated in red, orange and pink tones. Walls are covered with framed images of naked or semi-naked young women.

title: On Camera, Suicide Bomber Blows Himself Up Near Pak Checkpost, 4 Cops Dead
content: A suicide attack took place near a checkpost in Pakistan's Bhakkar district at 7pm on Tuesday. Two police personnel were killed in the explosion, while four others were injured.

title: 25,000 Students, Zero Teachers: Madhya Pradesh State Universities Sit Empty
content: The university is currently running undergraduate courses in agriculture, arts, commerce, and science, along with a postgraduate commerce program, but it is functioning entirely on temporary arrangements.

title: She Left For Christmas Shopping, Then Disappeared For 24 Years. Until Now
content: A North Carolina mom of three disappeared over 24 years ago when she supposedly left her home in Eden to do Christmas shopping at a Kmart in Virginia.

title: "Creative Freedom": Centre Backs Censor Certificate To Kerala Story 2
content: The government has backed the Film board certification to the sequel to 'Kerala Story" - the film that has landed in controversy after the release of its trailer - saying the film "does not threaten public order".

title: Opinion: Opinion | From Kerala To Keralam: What's Really In A Name? A Lot, Apparently
content: For many, the name change may be much ado about nothing, but for the likes of MN Karassery, who have been using Keralam instead of Kerala over the years, it is a moment to celebrate.

title: Ranking all 30 MLB lineups for 2026
content: Hall of Famer Rogers Hornsby uttered a romantic quote . "people ask me what I do in winter when there's no baseball," he said . he swaps cards from team to team, envisioning what the next summer would look like .

title: USA Basketball's road to 2028: New era, new coach, new decisions
content: in 2024, a team USA squad full of stars, role players, up-and-comers and legends survived two thrillers . a 95-91 win over Nikola Jokic -led Serbia squad and an exhausting 98-87 clincher over host France . it doesn't appear that USA Basketball's graybearded Avengers will reassemble to chase a sixth consecutive gold .

title: MMA divisional rankings: Heavyweight top 10 is light on changes or impact
content: the heavyweight division is seriously lacking in depth and activity at the top . the fight ended prematurely as a no-contest after he suffered eye pokes that required surgery and threaten to end his career . it's not going to stay in a valley forever, but MMA fans will await that day eagerly .

title: Trade grades: What can Brett Kulak do for the Avalanche?
